sub_title: Scientist, science area leader and project leader at Nouryon
summary:
I have 14 years of experience as a scientist (researcher), people manager, and project representative at the pharmaceutical and chemical industry. With a PhD in science (chemistry), I have been leading at industry many projects in the fields of organic synthesis, organometallic synthesis, homogeneous and heterogeneous catalysis, and analytical chemistry. I am used to work in Lean (5S organized) and GMP-regulated environment, and I know how to handle water- and air-sensitive materials.
I have a natural passion for learning and discovering new things. Therefore, my ambition is to work with or to lead activities/projects requiring creative thinking and strong collaborative efforts, especially in a multidisciplinary and research-oriented organization. Ideally such projects would involve elements of chemistry. Another aspect that I am interested and that I am talented is in teaching or coaching activities from students or personnel.
I have a “hands-on” type of personality preferring to be closely and actively engaged in projects and teams, but I also know when it is time to delegate. I find important to see a project through, not losing focus or milestones during its trajectory.

Areas of interest: 
Strategies and techniques for the preparation and analysis of materials
Quality control
Analytical chemistry
R&D
Spectroscopy
Automation
Science
Chemistry
Organic chemistry
Stereochemistry
Catalysis
Teaching, coaching, training of personnel
Manufacturing

profile_positions.description:
Examples of activities I executed at MSD (Schering-Plough and Organon):
•	Development and validation of spectroscopic analytical methods for the quality control of intermediates, of products in development-phase and of final manufactured products.
•	Validation of analytical instrumentation.
•	Writing and maintenance of SOP’s, the reporting and handling of OOS’s and OOT’s (out-of-spec and out-of-trend, respectively), and the design and implementation of tailor-made training courses for staff members.
•	The chemical analyses for the clinical and non-clinical releases of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API’s) and impurities in Lean (5S organized) and GMP-regulated environment.
•	Isolation and identification of impurities in drug substances and drug products including analysis of (potentially) genotoxic impurities. Chemical structures investigations carried out by spectroscopic techniques (e.g. mass spectrometry, NMR, IR, Raman and UV-Vis).
•	Investigations dealing with product formulation issues (material sciences), e.g. polymorphism, amorphism, effect of water (activity) on product critical quality attributes. Techniques commonly involved: XRPD, ESEM-EDX, solid-state NMR, IR, Raman, mDSC, TG and DVS.
•	Writing of scientific reports including supporting documents for the filing of drug substances and documents answering questions from authorities.
•	Promoting the scientific development of the spectroscopic section within the analytical department.
•	Departmental representative in project teams, and during internal and external inspections (e.g. from FDA, Nederlandse Overheid (IGZ), and Japanese PMDA).
•	Mentoring of students.
•	Coaching/management of staff.
